intro: Descurainia incisa var. filipes, commonly known as slender leafed tansy, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, thread-like leaves and small yellow flowers arranged in racemes. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. The species is often used in ecological restoration due to its hardy nature and ability to colonize degraded areas.
